page.title: 17HOUSING. UNUSUAL HOMES
page.content: {Pitlands Farm} Shottesbrooke is a converted barn and stable block. {Cartref Gan,}Littlewick Green, was built in the 19th Century. In 1920 it became the changing rooms for a swimming pool.{Ivor Novello} used it as a music studio in the 1930s. Extensions were added in 1965 & 1982. {The Old Post Office,}Knowl Hill, is now a house but has been a bakery and a Post Office.It was once the home of {Punch cartoonist, Leek.} The {G.W.R.}owned a cottage in Milley Lane until 1954. A sailing family built {T'Gallant} in {Hall's Lane}on the third plot sold by the large house next door.(That is the name given to the third sail on a sailing ship). Before the sale of the land the owners planted a tree of each kind that can be successfully grown in this area. Not all have survived.
